title: PCT 27: How the Blackfoot killed their wives
author: Mrs. Maggie Achenam

sentences.english: When they met a youth or even a boy, he became jealous of him.
“I can tell that youth is your man!” he said to her.
“Oh no! You say that just because he is your man,” he told her.

sentences.original: êh-nakiskawât owîkimâkanah êkwah pêyak nâpêsisah êh-wîcêwâyit, nîkân owîkimâkanah pa-pî-pimwêw.
sentences.text: ê-nakiskawât owîkimâkana êkwa pêyak nâpêsisa ê-wîcêwâyit nîkân owîkimâkana pa-pî-pimwêw
sentences.english: When he encountered his wife and a boy who was with her, first he shot arrow after arrow into his wife.

sentences.original: êkwah nâpêsisah mînah, mîn êyakonih pimwêw; nipahêw.
sentences.text: êkwa nâpêsisa mîna mîna êwakoni pimwêw nipahêw
sentences.english: Then the boy, too, him too he shot; he killed him.
Then he looked for the young man; he rode about in the woods.

sentences.original: êkwah, êkây âwiyak t-ôtinêw ôhih kâ-nipahimak, itwêw.
sentences.english: Then, “No one is to take up the bodies of those I have killed,” he said.

sentences.original: owîkimâkanah êkwah kotakah nâpêsisah, êyakonih mînah êh-nipahât, êkwah êkotah pimisinwak, ohcih ôh awiyah wîh-otinâyicih, ê-wîh-nipahât.
sentences.text: owîkimâkana êkwa kotaka nâpêsisa êwakoni mîna ê-nipahât êkwa êkota pimisinwak ohci ôhi awiya wî-otinâyici ê-wî-nipahât
sentences.english: His wife and the boy he had slain with her would lie there then, because if anyone were going to take them up, he would kill him.
This too was a custom of the Blackfoot;
before there was any law was when this took place;

sentences.original: mêkwâc paskwâwimostoswah êh-ohtâpanihocik ayîsiyiniwak, iyahciyiniwak, mînah pwâsîmowak, sasîwak, kinêpikôwiniwak, k-ôtaskîwikamikowak, nahkawiyiniwak, êyakw ânima kâ-kîh-ihkihk.
sentences.text: mêkwâc paskwâwi-mostoswa ê-ohtâpanihocik ayîsiyiniwak ayahciyiniwak mîna pwâsîmowak sasîwak kinêpikoyiniwak kâ-otaskîwikamikowak nahkawiyiniwak êwako anima kâ-kî-ihkihk
sentences.english: when the people were still living on buffalo-flesh, - the Blackfoot and the Assiniboine, the Sarsi, the Snakes, the Earth-Lodge People, the Salteaux, - that was when this took place.
sentences.footnote: LB on {k-ôtaskîwikamikowak}:  I have not been able to identify this tribe.
